definition: quotation (from a book or existing source)
Quotations from Chairman Mao Tse-Tung, published from 1964 to about 1976

sentences.english: Sayings of the power over long-winded.
sentences.chinese: 語錄體的力量超過長篇大論。

sentences.english: Some quotations seek an author, others lose them.
sentences.chinese: 有些語錄標明作者何人，而有些則查無此人。

sentences.english: But chatting chatting, broke a lot of classic quotations.
sentences.chinese: 但聊着聊着，爆出了不少經典語錄。

sentences.english: At dawn, the whole town wakes to recorded patriotic songs and messages blared from loudspeakers.
sentences.chinese: 天矇矇亮，喇叭裏就響徹着愛國歌曲和語錄。

sentences.english: Contend is a slogan guiding China's literature.
sentences.chinese: “百花齊放，百家爭鳴”是指導中國文學的一條語錄。

sentences.english: It has been 4 annuals since I clouded.
sentences.chinese: 我戒菸4年了，李燦新語錄。

sentences.english: Days in the field began and ended with reading quotations from Mao.
sentences.chinese: 日子以田間勞作開始，以毛語錄結束。

sentences.english: Besides, it is brought forward that Rujing Continued Quotation is spurious.
sentences.chinese: 並且提出《如淨續語錄》是僞作。

sentences.english: Reeducation involved memorizing speeches by Kim Il-sung and Kim Jong-il.
sentences.chinese: 改造“還包括背誦金日成和金正日的語錄。

sentences.english: What does that mean? Look at the very last saying.
sentences.chinese: 這是什麼意思，看最後一條語錄。

sentences.english: This is the opening sentence of the Confucian Analects, a record of the dialogues of Confucius and his disciples.
sentences.chinese: 這是孔子和他的弟子們的語錄《論語》的開頭一句話。

sentences.english: My quotation is the person is iron, rice is a steel, do not eat a meal hungry.
sentences.chinese: 我的語錄是人是鐵，飯是鋼，一頓不喫餓得慌。

sentences.english: First look at 13, these are some sayings that look more odd to us.
sentences.chinese: 首先看第13條，這些語錄我們可能會覺得有點奇怪。

definition: Four Books, namely: the Great Learning 大學|大学, the Doctrine of the Mean 中庸, the Analects of Confucius 論語|论语, and Mencius 孟子
current trends/the present situation/how things are going
to take down (in writing)/notes/a type of literature consisting mainly of short sketches/CL:本[ben3]
guide (e.g. book or other printed material)
dictionary/also written 詞典|词典[ci2 dian3]/CL:本[ben3],部[bu4]
to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
start of literary work/opening song of ballad in Tanci style 彈詞|弹词[tan2 ci2]
